definition: sides of a ship/ship's railing/fig. the dividing line between shipboard expenses and onshore freight charges
side of a ship or an aircraft

sentences.english: On June 24, we had a near-miss when an enemy plane dropped anti-personnel bombs near the starboard side of the ship.
sentences.chinese: 6月24日，我们的船的右侧船舷遭遇敌机仍的炸弹。

sentences.english: We gripped the sides of the boat as the waves tossed us about.
sentences.chinese: 那船颠簸得好厉害，我们只好紧握船舷。

sentences.english: The ship yawned as the heavy wave struck abeam.
sentences.chinese: 当巨浪向船舷撞击时，船开始左右摇摆。

sentences.english: Waves break helplessly against the boat each side.
sentences.chinese: 浪花无助地粉碎在两边船舷。

sentences.english: If the parties do not intend to deliver the goods across the ship's rail, the FCA term should he used.
sentences.chinese: 如当事各方无意越过船舷交货，则应使用FCA术语。

sentences.english: Noise in general becomes more striking, with waves slapping more determinedly at our sides.
sentences.chinese: 各种声响会更加惊心动魄，海浪拍打着船舷也更有力。

sentences.english: They are on board leaning over the rail arm in arm.
sentences.chinese: 他俩手挽着手倚在船舷的栏杆上。

sentences.english: Also , the boat was so small that when I rowed , the waves came over the sides of the boat .
sentences.chinese: 况且船这么小，我一划，海浪就从船舷涌进来。

sentences.english: He quickly held tightly onto the side with his hands. The people hauled him onto the ship.
sentences.chinese: 他连忙用双手紧紧地抱住船舷，人们把他拖到船上。

sentences.english: The man then made a mark on the side of the boat;
sentences.chinese: 他急忙在剑掉下去的船舷边上刻了一个记号。

definition: the bow or prow of a ship
